017package org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate;
018
019/**
020 * Class holding various entity data for HTML and XML - generally for use with
021 * the LookupTranslator.
022 * All arrays are of length [*][2].
023 *
024 * @since 3.0
025 * @deprecated As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text
026 * <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-text/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/text/translate/CodePointTranslator.html">
027 * EntityArrays</a> instead
028 */
029@Deprecated
030public class EntityArrays {
031
032    private static final String[][] ISO8859_1_ESCAPE = {
033        {"\u00A0", "&nbsp;"}, // non-breaking space
034        {"\u00A1", "&iexcl;"}, // inverted exclamation mark
035        {"\u00A2", "&cent;"}, // cent sign
036        {"\u00A3", "&pound;"}, // pound sign
037        {"\u00A4", "&curren;"}, // currency sign
038        {"\u00A5", "&yen;"}, // yen sign = yuan sign
039        {"\u00A6", "&brvbar;"}, // broken bar = broken vertical bar
040        {"\u00A7", "&sect;"}, // section sign
041        {"\u00A8", "&uml;"}, // dieresis = spacing dieresis
042        {"\u00A9", "&copy;"}, // © - copyright sign
043        {"\u00AA", "&ordf;"}, // feminine ordinal indicator
044        {"\u00AB", "&laquo;"}, // left-pointing double angle quotation mark = left pointing guillemet
045        {"\u00AC", "&not;"}, // not sign
046        {"\u00AD", "&shy;"}, // soft hyphen = discretionary hyphen
047        {"\u00AE", "&reg;"}, // ® - registered trademark sign
048        {"\u00AF", "&macr;"}, // macron = spacing macron = overline = APL overbar
049        {"\u00B0", "&deg;"}, // degree sign
050        {"\u00B1", "&plusmn;"}, // plus-minus sign = plus-or-minus sign
051        {"\u00B2", "&sup2;"}, // superscript two = superscript digit two = squared
052        {"\u00B3", "&sup3;"}, // superscript three = superscript digit three = cubed
053        {"\u00B4", "&acute;"}, // acute accent = spacing acute
054        {"\u00B5", "&micro;"}, // micro sign
055        {"\u00B6", "&para;"}, // pilcrow sign = paragraph sign
056        {"\u00B7", "&middot;"}, // middle dot = Georgian comma = Greek middle dot
057        {"\u00B8", "&cedil;"}, // cedilla = spacing cedilla
058        {"\u00B9", "&sup1;"}, // superscript one = superscript digit one
059        {"\u00BA", "&ordm;"}, // masculine ordinal indicator
060        {"\u00BB", "&raquo;"}, // right-pointing double angle quotation mark = right pointing guillemet
061        {"\u00BC", "&frac14;"}, // vulgar fraction one quarter = fraction one quarter
062        {"\u00BD", "&frac12;"}, // vulgar fraction one half = fraction one half
063        {"\u00BE", "&frac34;"}, // vulgar fraction three quarters = fraction three quarters
064        {"\u00BF", "&iquest;"}, // inverted question mark = turned question mark
065        {"\u00C0", "&Agrave;"}, // À - uppercase A, grave accent
066        {"\u00C1", "&Aacute;"}, // Á - uppercase A, acute accent
067        {"\u00C2", "&Acirc;"}, // Â - uppercase A, circumflex accent
068        {"\u00C3", "&Atilde;"}, // Ã - uppercase A, tilde
069        {"\u00C4", "&Auml;"}, // Ä - uppercase A, umlaut
070        {"\u00C5", "&Aring;"}, // Å - uppercase A, ring
071        {"\u00C6", "&AElig;"}, // Æ - uppercase AE
072        {"\u00C7", "&Ccedil;"}, // Ç - uppercase C, cedilla
073        {"\u00C8", "&Egrave;"}, // È - uppercase E, grave accent
074        {"\u00C9", "&Eacute;"}, // É - uppercase E, acute accent
075        {"\u00CA", "&Ecirc;"}, // Ê - uppercase E, circumflex accent
076        {"\u00CB", "&Euml;"}, // Ë - uppercase E, umlaut
077        {"\u00CC", "&Igrave;"}, // Ì - uppercase I, grave accent
078        {"\u00CD", "&Iacute;"}, // Í - uppercase I, acute accent
079        {"\u00CE", "&Icirc;"}, // Î - uppercase I, circumflex accent
080        {"\u00CF", "&Iuml;"}, // Ï - uppercase I, umlaut
081        {"\u00D0", "&ETH;"}, // Ð - uppercase Eth, Icelandic
082        {"\u00D1", "&Ntilde;"}, // Ñ - uppercase N, tilde
083        {"\u00D2", "&Ograve;"}, // Ò - uppercase O, grave accent
084        {"\u00D3", "&Oacute;"}, // Ó - uppercase O, acute accent
085        {"\u00D4", "&Ocirc;"}, // Ô - uppercase O, circumflex accent
086        {"\u00D5", "&Otilde;"}, // Õ - uppercase O, tilde
087        {"\u00D6", "&Ouml;"}, // Ö - uppercase O, umlaut
088        {"\u00D7", "&times;"}, // multiplication sign
089        {"\u00D8", "&Oslash;"}, // Ø - uppercase O, slash
090        {"\u00D9", "&Ugrave;"}, // Ù - uppercase U, grave accent
091        {"\u00DA", "&Uacute;"}, // Ú - uppercase U, acute accent
092        {"\u00DB", "&Ucirc;"}, // Û - uppercase U, circumflex accent
093        {"\u00DC", "&Uuml;"}, // Ü - uppercase U, umlaut
094        {"\u00DD", "&Yacute;"}, // Ý - uppercase Y, acute accent
095        {"\u00DE", "&THORN;"}, // Þ - uppercase THORN, Icelandic
096        {"\u00DF", "&szlig;"}, // ß - lowercase sharps, German
097        {"\u00E0", "&agrave;"}, // à - lowercase a, grave accent
098        {"\u00E1", "&aacute;"}, // á - lowercase a, acute accent
099        {"\u00E2", "&acirc;"}, // â - lowercase a, circumflex accent
100        {"\u00E3", "&atilde;"}, // ã - lowercase a, tilde
101        {"\u00E4", "&auml;"}, // ä - lowercase a, umlaut
102        {"\u00E5", "&aring;"}, // å - lowercase a, ring
103        {"\u00E6", "&aelig;"}, // æ - lowercase ae
104        {"\u00E7", "&ccedil;"}, // ç - lowercase c, cedilla
105        {"\u00E8", "&egrave;"}, // è - lowercase e, grave accent
106        {"\u00E9", "&eacute;"}, // é - lowercase e, acute accent
107        {"\u00EA", "&ecirc;"}, // ê - lowercase e, circumflex accent
108        {"\u00EB", "&euml;"}, // ë - lowercase e, umlaut
109        {"\u00EC", "&igrave;"}, // ì - lowercase i, grave accent
110        {"\u00ED", "&iacute;"}, // í - lowercase i, acute accent
111        {"\u00EE", "&icirc;"}, // î - lowercase i, circumflex accent
112        {"\u00EF", "&iuml;"}, // ï - lowercase i, umlaut
113        {"\u00F0", "&eth;"}, // ð - lowercase eth, Icelandic
114        {"\u00F1", "&ntilde;"}, // ñ - lowercase n, tilde
115        {"\u00F2", "&ograve;"}, // ò - lowercase o, grave accent
116        {"\u00F3", "&oacute;"}, // ó - lowercase o, acute accent
117        {"\u00F4", "&ocirc;"}, // ô - lowercase o, circumflex accent
118        {"\u00F5", "&otilde;"}, // õ - lowercase o, tilde
119        {"\u00F6", "&ouml;"}, // ö - lowercase o, umlaut
120        {"\u00F7", "&divide;"}, // division sign
121        {"\u00F8", "&oslash;"}, // ø - lowercase o, slash
122        {"\u00F9", "&ugrave;"}, // ù - lowercase u, grave accent
123        {"\u00FA", "&uacute;"}, // ú - lowercase u, acute accent
124        {"\u00FB", "&ucirc;"}, // û - lowercase u, circumflex accent
125        {"\u00FC", "&uuml;"}, // ü - lowercase u, umlaut
126        {"\u00FD", "&yacute;"}, // ý - lowercase y, acute accent
127        {"\u00FE", "&thorn;"}, // þ - lowercase thorn, Icelandic
128        {"\u00FF", "&yuml;"}, // ÿ - lowercase y, umlaut
129    };
130
131    private static final String[][] ISO8859_1_UNESCAPE = invert(ISO8859_1_ESCAPE);
132

187        {"\u03D1", "&thetasym;"}, // greek small letter theta symbol, U+03D1 NEW -->
188        {"\u03D2", "&upsih;"}, // greek upsilon with hook symbol, U+03D2 NEW -->
189        {"\u03D6", "&piv;"}, // greek pi symbol, U+03D6 ISOgrk3 -->
190        // <!-- General Punctuation -->
191        {"\u2022", "&bull;"}, // bullet = black small circle, U+2022 ISOpub -->
192        // <!-- bullet is NOT the same as bullet operator, U+2219 -->
193        {"\u2026", "&hellip;"}, // horizontal ellipsis = three dot leader, U+2026 ISOpub -->
194        {"\u2032", "&prime;"}, // prime = minutes = feet, U+2032 ISOtech -->
195        {"\u2033", "&Prime;"}, // double prime = seconds = inches, U+2033 ISOtech -->
196        {"\u203E", "&oline;"}, // overline = spacing overscore, U+203E NEW -->
197        {"\u2044", "&frasl;"}, // fraction slash, U+2044 NEW -->
198        // <!-- Letterlike Symbols -->
199        {"\u2118", "&weierp;"}, // script capital P = power set= Weierstrass p, U+2118 ISOamso -->
200        {"\u2111", "&image;"}, // blackletter capital I = imaginary part, U+2111 ISOamso -->
201        {"\u211C", "&real;"}, // blackletter capital R = real part symbol, U+211C ISOamso -->
202        {"\u2122", "&trade;"}, // trade mark sign, U+2122 ISOnum -->
203        {"\u2135", "&alefsym;"}, // alef symbol = first transfinite cardinal, U+2135 NEW -->
204        // <!-- alef symbol is NOT the same as hebrew letter alef, U+05D0 although the
205        // same glyph could be used to depict both characters -->
206        // <!-- Arrows -->
207        {"\u2190", "&larr;"}, // leftwards arrow, U+2190 ISOnum -->
208        {"\u2191", "&uarr;"}, // upwards arrow, U+2191 ISOnum-->
209        {"\u2192", "&rarr;"}, // rightwards arrow, U+2192 ISOnum -->
210        {"\u2193", "&darr;"}, // downwards arrow, U+2193 ISOnum -->
211        {"\u2194", "&harr;"}, // left right arrow, U+2194 ISOamsa -->
212        {"\u21B5", "&crarr;"}, // downwards arrow with corner leftwards= carriage return, U+21B5 NEW -->
213        {"\u21D0", "&lArr;"}, // leftwards double arrow, U+21D0 ISOtech -->
214        // <!-- ISO 10646 does not say that lArr is the same as the 'is implied by'
215        // arrow but also does not have any other character for that function.
216        // So ? lArr canbe used for 'is implied by' as ISOtech suggests -->
217        {"\u21D1", "&uArr;"}, // upwards double arrow, U+21D1 ISOamsa -->
218        {"\u21D2", "&rArr;"}, // rightwards double arrow, U+21D2 ISOtech -->
219        // <!-- ISO 10646 does not say this is the 'implies' character but does not
220        // have another character with this function so ?rArr can be used for
221        // 'implies' as ISOtech suggests -->
222        {"\u21D3", "&dArr;"}, // downwards double arrow, U+21D3 ISOamsa -->
223        {"\u21D4", "&hArr;"}, // left right double arrow, U+21D4 ISOamsa -->
224        // <!-- Mathematical Operators -->
225        {"\u2200", "&forall;"}, // for all, U+2200 ISOtech -->
226        {"\u2202", "&part;"}, // partial differential, U+2202 ISOtech -->
227        {"\u2203", "&exist;"}, // there exists, U+2203 ISOtech -->
228        {"\u2205", "&empty;"}, // empty set = null set = diameter, U+2205 ISOamso -->
229        {"\u2207", "&nabla;"}, // nabla = backward difference, U+2207 ISOtech -->
230        {"\u2208", "&isin;"}, // element of, U+2208 ISOtech -->
231        {"\u2209", "&notin;"}, // not an element of, U+2209 ISOtech -->
232        {"\u220B", "&ni;"}, // contains as member, U+220B ISOtech -->
233        // <!-- should there be a more memorable name than 'ni'? -->
234        {"\u220F", "&prod;"}, // n-ary product = product sign, U+220F ISOamsb -->
235        // <!-- prod is NOT the same character as U+03A0 'greek capital letter pi'
236        // though the same glyph might be used for both -->
237        {"\u2211", "&sum;"}, // n-ary summation, U+2211 ISOamsb -->
238        // <!-- sum is NOT the same character as U+03A3 'greek capital letter sigma'
239        // though the same glyph might be used for both -->
240        {"\u2212", "&minus;"}, // minus sign, U+2212 ISOtech -->
241        {"\u2217", "&lowast;"}, // asterisk operator, U+2217 ISOtech -->
242        {"\u221A", "&radic;"}, // square root = radical sign, U+221A ISOtech -->
243        {"\u221D", "&prop;"}, // proportional to, U+221D ISOtech -->
244        {"\u221E", "&infin;"}, // infinity, U+221E ISOtech -->
245        {"\u2220", "&ang;"}, // angle, U+2220 ISOamso -->
246        {"\u2227", "&and;"}, // logical and = wedge, U+2227 ISOtech -->
247        {"\u2228", "&or;"}, // logical or = vee, U+2228 ISOtech -->
248        {"\u2229", "&cap;"}, // intersection = cap, U+2229 ISOtech -->
249        {"\u222A", "&cup;"}, // union = cup, U+222A ISOtech -->
250        {"\u222B", "&int;"}, // integral, U+222B ISOtech -->
251        {"\u2234", "&there4;"}, // therefore, U+2234 ISOtech -->
252        {"\u223C", "&sim;"}, // tilde operator = varies with = similar to, U+223C ISOtech -->
253        // <!-- tilde operator is NOT the same character as the tilde, U+007E, although
254        // the same glyph might be used to represent both -->
255        {"\u2245", "&cong;"}, // approximately equal to, U+2245 ISOtech -->
256        {"\u2248", "&asymp;"}, // almost equal to = asymptotic to, U+2248 ISOamsr -->
257        {"\u2260", "&ne;"}, // not equal to, U+2260 ISOtech -->
258        {"\u2261", "&equiv;"}, // identical to, U+2261 ISOtech -->
259        {"\u2264", "&le;"}, // less-than or equal to, U+2264 ISOtech -->
260        {"\u2265", "&ge;"}, // greater-than or equal to, U+2265 ISOtech -->
261        {"\u2282", "&sub;"}, // subset of, U+2282 ISOtech -->
262        {"\u2283", "&sup;"}, // superset of, U+2283 ISOtech -->
263        // <!-- note that nsup, 'not a superset of, U+2283' is not covered by the
264        // Symbol font encoding and is not included. Should it be, for symmetry?
265        // It is in ISOamsn -->,
266        {"\u2284", "&nsub;"}, // not a subset of, U+2284 ISOamsn -->
267        {"\u2286", "&sube;"}, // subset of or equal to, U+2286 ISOtech -->
268        {"\u2287", "&supe;"}, // superset of or equal to, U+2287 ISOtech -->
269        {"\u2295", "&oplus;"}, // circled plus = direct sum, U+2295 ISOamsb -->
270        {"\u2297", "&otimes;"}, // circled times = vector product, U+2297 ISOamsb -->
271        {"\u22A5", "&perp;"}, // up tack = orthogonal to = perpendicular, U+22A5 ISOtech -->
272        {"\u22C5", "&sdot;"}, // dot operator, U+22C5 ISOamsb -->
273        // <!-- dot operator is NOT the same character as U+00B7 middle dot -->
274        // <!-- Miscellaneous Technical -->
275        {"\u2308", "&lceil;"}, // left ceiling = apl upstile, U+2308 ISOamsc -->
276        {"\u2309", "&rceil;"}, // right ceiling, U+2309 ISOamsc -->
277        {"\u230A", "&lfloor;"}, // left floor = apl downstile, U+230A ISOamsc -->
278        {"\u230B", "&rfloor;"}, // right floor, U+230B ISOamsc -->
279        {"\u2329", "&lang;"}, // left-pointing angle bracket = bra, U+2329 ISOtech -->
280        // <!-- lang is NOT the same character as U+003C 'less than' or U+2039 'single left-pointing angle quotation
281        // mark' -->
282        {"\u232A", "&rang;"}, // right-pointing angle bracket = ket, U+232A ISOtech -->
283        // <!-- rang is NOT the same character as U+003E 'greater than' or U+203A
284        // 'single right-pointing angle quotation mark' -->
285        // <!-- Geometric Shapes -->
286        {"\u25CA", "&loz;"}, // lozenge, U+25CA ISOpub -->
287        // <!-- Miscellaneous Symbols -->
288        {"\u2660", "&spades;"}, // black spade suit, U+2660 ISOpub -->
289        // <!-- black here seems to mean filled as opposed to hollow -->
290        {"\u2663", "&clubs;"}, // black club suit = shamrock, U+2663 ISOpub -->
291        {"\u2665", "&hearts;"}, // black heart suit = valentine, U+2665 ISOpub -->
292        {"\u2666", "&diams;"}, // black diamond suit, U+2666 ISOpub -->
293
294        // <!-- Latin Extended-A -->
295        {"\u0152", "&OElig;"}, // -- latin capital ligature OE, U+0152 ISOlat2 -->
296        {"\u0153", "&oelig;"}, // -- latin small ligature oe, U+0153 ISOlat2 -->
297        // <!-- ligature is a misnomer, this is a separate character in some languages -->
298        {"\u0160", "&Scaron;"}, // -- latin capital letter S with caron, U+0160 ISOlat2 -->
299        {"\u0161", "&scaron;"}, // -- latin small letter s with caron, U+0161 ISOlat2 -->
300        {"\u0178", "&Yuml;"}, // -- latin capital letter Y with dieresis, U+0178 ISOlat2 -->
301        // <!-- Spacing Modifier Letters -->
302        {"\u02C6", "&circ;"}, // -- modifier letter circumflex accent, U+02C6 ISOpub -->
303        {"\u02DC", "&tilde;"}, // small tilde, U+02DC ISOdia -->

305        {"\u2002", "&ensp;"}, // en space, U+2002 ISOpub -->
306        {"\u2003", "&emsp;"}, // em space, U+2003 ISOpub -->
307        {"\u2009", "&thinsp;"}, // thin space, U+2009 ISOpub -->
308        {"\u200C", "&zwnj;"}, // zero width non-joiner, U+200C NEW RFC 2070 -->
309        {"\u200D", "&zwj;"}, // zero width joiner, U+200D NEW RFC 2070 -->
310        {"\u200E", "&lrm;"}, // left-to-right mark, U+200E NEW RFC 2070 -->
311        {"\u200F", "&rlm;"}, // right-to-left mark, U+200F NEW RFC 2070 -->
312        {"\u2013", "&ndash;"}, // en dash, U+2013 ISOpub -->
313        {"\u2014", "&mdash;"}, // em dash, U+2014 ISOpub -->
314        {"\u2018", "&lsquo;"}, // left single quotation mark, U+2018 ISOnum -->
315        {"\u2019", "&rsquo;"}, // right single quotation mark, U+2019 ISOnum -->
316        {"\u201A", "&sbquo;"}, // single low-9 quotation mark, U+201A NEW -->
317        {"\u201C", "&ldquo;"}, // left double quotation mark, U+201C ISOnum -->
318        {"\u201D", "&rdquo;"}, // right double quotation mark, U+201D ISOnum -->
319        {"\u201E", "&bdquo;"}, // double low-9 quotation mark, U+201E NEW -->
320        {"\u2020", "&dagger;"}, // dagger, U+2020 ISOpub -->
321        {"\u2021", "&Dagger;"}, // double dagger, U+2021 ISOpub -->
322        {"\u2030", "&permil;"}, // per mille sign, U+2030 ISOtech -->
323        {"\u2039", "&lsaquo;"}, // single left-pointing angle quotation mark, U+2039 ISO proposed -->
324        // <!-- lsaquo is proposed but not yet ISO standardized -->
325        {"\u203A", "&rsaquo;"}, // single right-pointing angle quotation mark, U+203A ISO proposed -->
326        // <!-- rsaquo is proposed but not yet ISO standardized -->
327        {"\u20AC", "&euro;"}, // -- euro sign, U+20AC NEW -->
328    };
329
330    private static final String[][] HTML40_EXTENDED_UNESCAPE = invert(HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE);
331
332    private static final String[][] BASIC_ESCAPE = {
333        {"\"", "&quot;"}, // " - double-quote
334        {"&", "&amp;"},   // & - ampersand
335        {"<", "&lt;"},    // < - less-than
336        {">", "&gt;"},    // > - greater-than
337    };
338
339    private static final String[][] BASIC_UNESCAPE = invert(BASIC_ESCAPE);
340
341    private static final String[][] APOS_ESCAPE = {
342        {"'", "&apos;"}, // XML apostrophe
343    };
344
345    private static final String[][] APOS_UNESCAPE = invert(APOS_ESCAPE);
346
347    private static final String[][] JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE = {
348        {"\b", "\\b"},
349        {"\n", "\\n"},
350        {"\t", "\\t"},
351        {"\f", "\\f"},
352        {"\r", "\\r"}
353    };
354
355    private static final String[][] JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_UNESCAPE = invert(JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE);
356
357    /**
358     * Mapping to escape the apostrophe character to its XML character entity.
359     * @return the mapping table
360     */
361    public static String[][] APOS_ESCAPE() {
362        return APOS_ESCAPE.clone();
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Reverse of {@link #APOS_ESCAPE()} for unescaping purposes.
367     * @return the mapping table
368     */
369    public static String[][] APOS_UNESCAPE() {
370        return APOS_UNESCAPE.clone();
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Mapping to escape the basic XML and HTML character entities.
375     *
376     * Namely: {@code " & < >}
377     * @return the mapping table
378     */
379    public static String[][] BASIC_ESCAPE() {
380        return BASIC_ESCAPE.clone();
381    }
382
383    /**
384     * Reverse of {@link #BASIC_ESCAPE()} for unescaping purposes.
385     * @return the mapping table
386     */
387    public static String[][] BASIC_UNESCAPE() {
388        return BASIC_UNESCAPE.clone();
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Mapping to escape additional <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">character entity
393     * references</a>. Note that this must be used with {@link #ISO8859_1_ESCAPE()} to get the full list of
394     * HTML 4.0 character entities.
395     * @return the mapping table
396     */
397    public static String[][] HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE() {
398        return HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE.clone();
399    }
400
401    /**
402     * Reverse of {@link #HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE()} for unescaping purposes.
403     * @return the mapping table
404     */
405    public static String[][] HTML40_EXTENDED_UNESCAPE() {
406        return HTML40_EXTENDED_UNESCAPE.clone();
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Used to invert an escape array into an unescape array
411     * @param array String[][] to be inverted
412     * @return String[][] inverted array
413     */
414    public static String[][] invert(final String[][] array) {
415        final String[][] newarray = new String[array.length][2];
416        for (int i = 0; i<array.length; i++) {
417            newarray[i][0] = array[i][1];
418            newarray[i][1] = array[i][0];
419        }
420        return newarray;
421    }
422
423    /**
424     * Mapping to escape <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/ISO/IEC_8859-1">ISO-8859-1</a>
425     * characters to their named HTML 3.x equivalents.
426     * @return the mapping table
427     */
428    public static String[][] ISO8859_1_ESCAPE() {
429        return ISO8859_1_ESCAPE.clone();
430    }
431
432    /**
433     * Reverse of {@link #ISO8859_1_ESCAPE()} for unescaping purposes.
434     * @return the mapping table
435     */
436    public static String[][] ISO8859_1_UNESCAPE() {
437        return ISO8859_1_UNESCAPE.clone();
438    }
439
440    /**
441     * Mapping to escape the Java control characters.
442     *
443     * Namely: {@code \b \n \t \f \r}
444     * @return the mapping table
445     */
446    public static String[][] JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE() {
447        return JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE.clone();
448    }
449
450    /**
451     * Reverse of {@link #JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE()} for unescaping purposes.
452     * @return the mapping table
453     */
454    public static String[][] JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_UNESCAPE() {
455        return JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_UNESCAPE.clone();
456    }
457
458}
